reviewText: This was a gift for our five year old who loves these movies.  He really likes anything to do with karate.

My son Patrick loves these movies. I have seen them a few times each. The five stars are not for quality in acting or writing. The five stars is for the total joy my son gets everytime he watches them!!!

My daughter received this DVD for Christmas and watches it all the time. There are 3 episodes on the DVD and they are all good.  Both my son and daughter enjoy watching this DVD, they even dance to the music in one of the videos.
My son is in Kepo Karate and he just loves these movies. They also teach the children about working together and not to brag about their Karate skills

My grandson loves watching these movies, however we had to stop letting him watch them as he started kicking and "aiya-ing" people and our dogs. Some of the "humor" in the movies when the bad guy was hit involved the bad guy's private parts being hit.  Unfortunately, my grandson also picked up on this and started hitting the same way. We have stopped letting him watch these movies for now.  He is 4-1/2 years old.
Arrived quickly!  Brand new!
Seeing a trio a ninja warrior brothers on many more adventure with bad guys to deal with all the way.

It would be great if I could get this trilogy set for myself through amazon and get it sent out to New Zealand as these movies are very hard to get these days as I really loved watching these movies when I was in my teens
Great together now have completed set.
The kids enjoyed these movies that i grew up watching.

This film is a cute, warm fare filled with kids (3 brothers) coming to the rescue! It is obvious that it is a copy-cat of the more famous, 'Karate Kid' but I don't believe that matters. What matters is it is for young children who still believe in family and that even kids can still win the great battles.
Released in 1994, this warmhearted film shared the stage with such notables as 'Richie Rich', 'Matilda' and 'Beethoven'. I think today's viewers need to understand that time frame and give this kiddie film a chance.
I know that my children loved the 3 Ninjas so much that they literally wore out the discs once already. I also might add that this also inspired both of my kids to take karate!

This 3-disc offering will give the younger set a great afternoon of 'hi-yahs' and karate chop action not to mention letting the parents relax knowing this is truly a family affair.

My 8 yr old grandson loves all things ninja - & this 3 Ninjas DVD set is one of his favorites.  These movies are made for children - have lots of ninja action - but are not "adult violent."  I recommend this set & also the "3 Ninjas" - the original movie of the series.

This a 3 Ninjas *set*, but not the actual trilogy. The 3 Ninjas had produced 4 movies. The actual triology was "3 Ninjas", "3 Ninjas: Kick back", and "3 Ninjas: Knuckle Up". This is not what is listed, which I found out the hard way. The original first movie is not in this set. The "3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain" was produced in the late 1990s, with only 3 of the original characters. The ninja boys are different actors. The movie are decent, considering they were produced in the 90s with young actors. Some parts are obviously staged, but its still good. However, don't expect excellent acting and writing.

Bought this for my grandkids. They love these movies. Three young brothers that learn the art of ninja from their grandfather and the predicaments they get into trying to help their friends. Excellent. Good clean fun and excitement.

I loved these movies when I was a kid. Bought these on DVD for my 3 boys and they also absolutely love them. Needless to say they always pretend to be them. The youngest is 2 and when he's playing "3 Ninjas" if u call him by his name (Gavin) he will say "No, I'm Tum Tum". Too cute!! Great movies!
